intro: Haplostachys linearifolia, commonly known as the desert willow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features slender, often twining stems and lance-shaped leaves that are gray-green in color. Its showy, tubular flowers bloom in shades of pink, purple, or white, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. Haplostachys linearifolia is adapted to drought conditions and can thrive in well-drained soils.
